title: U.N. rights boss calls for referring Myanmar to ICC for Rohingya crimes
text: March 9, 2018 / 9:01 AM / in 21 minutes U.N. rights boss calls for referring Myanmar to ICC for Rohingya crimes Reuters Staff 1 Min Read GENEVA (Reuters) - The top United Nations human rights official called on Friday for alleged atrocities committed against the Muslim Rohingya minority in Myanmar to be referred to the International Criminal Court (ICC) for prosecution. U.N. High Commissioner for Human Rights Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein talks to reporters in Jakarta Indonesia February 7, 2018. REUTERS/Beawiharta/Files Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, U.N. High Commissioner for Human Rights, also urged Myanmar’s government to allow monitors into northern Rakhine state to investigate what he called suspected “acts of genocide” against the Muslim minority. “We are saying there are strong suspicions that, yes, acts of genocide may have taken place. But only a court can confirm this,” Zeid told a news conference in Geneva. Reporting by Stephanie Nebehay; editing by Tom Miles
